definition: lit. a fish in a dried out rut (idiom)/fig. a person in dire straits
to dry/to dry up
to remove/to withdraw
rut/track/rhyme/(dialect) way/method
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
silver carp
lit. a notch on the side of a boat to locate a sword dropped overboard (idiom); fig. an action made pointless by changed circumstances
at dawn, not sure of lasting to evening (idiom); precarious state/imminent crisis/living from hand to mouth
Chinese set expression, typically of 4 characters, often alluding to a story or historical quotation/idiom/proverb/saying/adage/CL:條|条[tiao2],本[ben3],句[ju4]
lit. fight tigers with one's bare hands and wade across raging rivers (idiom)/fig. to display foolhardy courage

lit. Ying writes a letter and Yan reads it/fig. to misinterpret the original meaning/to pile up errors/refers to the letter from capital 郢[Ying3] of 楚[Chu3] in which the inadvertent words "hold up the candle" are mistaken by the minister of 燕[Yan1] as "promote the wise"
to pluck a pearl from the black dragon (idiom, from Zhuangzi); fig. to pick out the salient points (from a tangled situation)/to see through to the nub
lit. catch fish then forget the trap (idiom, from Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子); fig. to take help for granted
lit. climb a tree to catch a fish (idiom); fig. to attempt the impossible
tyrannical government is fiercer than a tiger (idiom)
can be compared to/is the same as
in deep water/difficult situation
lit. an old ox licking its calf (idiom)/fig. (of parents) to dote on one's children
indiscriminately included in company (without any qualification)/see 濫竽充數|滥竽充数[lan4 yu2 chong1 shu4]
to beg while playing the xiao 箫 (mouth organ)/cf Wu Zixu 伍子胥, destitute refugee from Chu 楚, busked in Wu town c. 520 BC, then became a powerful politician
see 喪家之犬|丧家之犬[sang4 jia1 zhi1 quan3]
lit. to carry firewood to put out a fire (idiom); fig. to make a problem worse by inappropriate action
